simlib.analysis.peptide.SecondaryStructure¶

class simlib.analysis.peptide.SecondaryStructure(data)[source]¶

Store the result of secondary structure computation through STRIDE.

By itself, an instance of SecondaryStructure is not a Quantity. There are several options for converting an instance of SecondaryStructure to a Quantity.

mean(axis=None, codes=None)[source]¶

Compute the average secondary structure by code for the entire protein (axis = None), each structure (axis = 0), or each residue (axis = 1).

Parameters

  • axis (None or int.) – Designates if the average should be computed for the entire protein (axis = None), each structure (axis = 0), or each residue (axis = 1).

  • codes (str) – The secondary structure codes to compute.

Returns

If axis = None, pandas.Series is returned. Otherwise, the result will be pandas.DataFrame.

Return type

pandas.Series or pandas.DataFrame

residues_with_code(code, residue_id=None)[source]¶

Quantity

Parameters

  • code –

  • residue_id –
